title: TUSG% in 60 seconds: Stop using USG% wrong

hook.text:
You've been using Usage % wrong this whole time. Let me show you why TUSG% is better.

[On-screen text: "TRADITIONAL USG% IS BROKEN 🚨"]

Traditional Usage % ignores pace. A player in 1962 played at 126 possessions per game. Today? 99. That's broken math.

explanation.text:
TUSG% fixes this. True Usage % = how much a player controls the offense, adjusted for team pace.

[Show formula graphic: (FGA + TOV + FTA×0.44) / (MIN/48 × Pace) × 100]

It answers: 'If this player was on ANY team, how much would they dominate the ball?'

Now we can compare Wilt to Harden. Modern stars to '80s legends. Fair math.

example.text:
Russell Westbrook 2017: 48.1% TUSG - highest EVER. He controlled nearly HALF his team's possessions.

[Show graphic: Westbrook 48.1% > League Average 20%]

That's why he averaged a triple-double. Pure ball dominance.
